faq1_title: How can I create a Mapstory?
faq1_texta: a.) You can sign up and create your own story.
faq1_textb: b.) You can view ready-made Mapstories in the gallery and get inspired by the topics.
faq2_title: What can I use Mapstories for?
faq2_texta: You can use Mapstories for virtually anything. It works especially well for stories that take place in different locations (around the world) and where the locations are somehow interconnected. These include supply chains, migration routes, and global networks.
faq2_lista: What are the stations on your school or work commute?
faq2_listb: Where does the wood for my chair come from exactly?
faq2_listc: Where does my T-shirt and its components (yarn, dyes, etc.) come from, and how do people live there?
faq2_listd: Where does the orange juice come from, how do the pickers live, and how is the environment there?
faq2_liste: Where did my grandparents migrate from to Germany, and what places and stories are in between?
faq2_listf: Where do other activists live around the world?
faq2_listg: Where are all the dried-up lakes in the world, and what is being done about it?
faq3_title: Can I use Mapstories for free?
faq3_text: Yes, the tool is free to use.
faq4_title: Which browsers does Mapstories work in?
faq4_text: Mapstories works in all popular browsers. It is completely web-based, so no installation is required.

faq6_title: What do I need to share a story with friends?
faq6_text: Just click on 'Share' and send the link through any popular apps.
faq7_title: Can I embed a Mapstory into a website?
faq7_text: Yes, that is possible. You can find the embedding code under the 'Share' button. You can adjust the size to fit your webpage.
faq8_text: Your Mapstory is automatically saved in your account. You can access and edit it once you have logged in.
